>>Weather Amsterdam

The climatic conditions in Amsterdam are characterized by a warm and temperate atmosphere. There is significant rainfall throughout the year in Amsterdam. Even the driest month still has a lot of rainfall. The Köppen-Geiger climate classification is Cfb. The average annual temperature in Amsterdam is 10.7 °C | 51.2 °F. Approximately 844 mm | 33.2 inch of rainfall occurs on a yearly basis.

Climate graph // Weather by Month Amsterdam

The month characterized by the lowest precipitation levels is February, exhibiting a mere 57 mm | 2.2 inch of rainfall. Most precipitation falls in July, with an average of 88 mm | 3.5 inch.

average temperature by month Amsterdam

On average, the month of July experiences the highest temperature with an average value of 18.0 °C | 64.3 °F. In January, the average temperature is 3.9 °C | 39.1 °F. It is the lowest average temperature of the whole year.

There is a notable fluctuation in precipitation, with 31 mm | 1 inch variance observed between the month of least rainfall and that of highest downpour. The average temperatures vary during the year by 14.0 °C | 25.3 °F.

The month with the highest relative humidity is November (85.72 %). The month with the lowest relative humidity is May (74.44 %). The month with the highest number of rainy days is July (14.37 days). The month with the lowest number of rainy days is February (11.37 days).

From Tulips to Canals: Planning Your Amsterdam Adventure Around the Seasons

Amsterdam, a city celebrated for its artistic heritage, intricate canal system, and vibrant cultural scene, offers a unique experience in every season, each adorned with distinct weather patterns that can influence your travel plans and activities.

Winter

Winter in Amsterdam is mild but damp, with temperatures hovering around 3.9°C (39°F) in January and February, occasionally dipping to 2°C (36°F) at night. The city experiences limited sunshine, averaging just 3.1 to 4.2 hours per day, and frequent rainfall, with 9 to 10 rainy days per month. While the cold and wet conditions might seem daunting, they bring a tranquil charm to the city’s streets, perfect for enjoying cozy cafés or the glittering holiday lights.

Spring

Spring marks a delightful transition with temperatures rising from a brisk 6.1°C (43°F) in March to a more pleasant 13.1°C (56°F) by May. Rainfall decreases, making April the driest month with only 57mm of precipitation. With up to 9.1 hours of sunshine per day in May, it is an ideal time to witness the blooming tulips and vibrant street markets, or to take leisurely bike rides along the canals.

Summer

Summer sees the warmest weather, with July temperatures peaking at 18°C (64°F). Despite being the sunniest months, with up to 9.7 hours of sunlight, there is still a significant amount of rainfall, especially in July with 88mm. This season is perfect for outdoor festivals, canal cruises, and picnics in Vondelpark, although it’s also the peak tourist season.

Autumn

Autumn features cooling temperatures, from a mild 15.4°C (60°F) in September to a chillier 7.8°C (46°F) in November. Sunlight decreases to between 3.7 and 6.9 hours as the months progress. The crisp air and golden hues of the falling leaves provide a picturesque setting for exploring outdoor markets or the city’s famed museums.

Best time to visit Amsterdam

The best times to visit Amsterdam are late spring (April to June) and early autumn (September to October) when you can enjoy mild weather, fewer tourists, and lower prices, alongside the beautiful spring blooms and autumnal colors.

When packing for Amsterdam, prepare for changeable weather. Essentials include lightweight, waterproof clothing for the unpredictable rain showers, and warm layers like sweaters and jackets for the cooler evenings, especially during spring and autumn. Comfortable walking shoes are a must for exploring the city on foot or by bike. Don’t forget to pack a sun hat and sunglasses for the sunnier days, and always have an umbrella handy.

In conclusion, each season in Amsterdam has its allure, offering various activities suited to its climate. Whether it’s winter’s festive lights, spring’s colorful gardens, summer’s vibrant festivals, or autumn’s historical ambience, Amsterdam promises a memorable visit year-round.

Total hours of sun

In Amsterdam, the month with the most daily hours of sunshine is July with an average of 9.72 hours of sunshine. In total there are 301.19 hours of sunshine throughout July.

The month with the fewest daily hours of sunshine in Amsterdam is January with an average of 3.1 hours of sunshine a day. In total there are 95.95 hours of sunshine in January.

Around 2347.81 hours of sunshine are counted in Amsterdam throughout the year. On average there are 77.05 hours of sunshine per month.
